validator.cycletime2: Only integer multiples of 1 ms are valid
validator.name: The name is invalid
validator.name15: The name has more than 15 characters

edit.trigger.title: The trigger source for the Scheduler task can be configured:
edit.trigger.timer.info: Timers of the operating system are used to trigger the Scheduler.
edit.trigger.interrupt.info: An internal interrupt is used to trigger the Scheduler.

tooltip.inactiv: To activate this function, switch to CONFIG state
tooltip.add: Adds a callable to the program
tooltip.deletecall: Deletes a callable from the program
tooltip.reset.disabled: To reset the scheduler configuration to default, first switch to the state 'Setup' in the header
tooltip.switchautomatic.disabled: To switch the automatic mode, first switch to the state 'Setup' in the header

info.callout:
Automatic program configuration
Upon app installation tasks are adjusted by the system. Only a few count of parameters can be changed individually.
Disable the feature for a full custom configuration.

reset.title: Resets the scheduler configuration to default
reset.desc: The scheduler configuration will be reseted to the default configuration. The current configuration will be lost
reset.info: The Scheduler configuration has been reseted to default

progConfigMode.switchToAutoDesc: Tasks and callables will be adjusted automatically. The current task configuration will be lost.
progConfigMode.switchToManualDesc: Any changes to tasks and callables will have to be made by hand. Switching back to automatic program configuration will reset all configuration changes.
progConfigMode.infoText: You might create an archive within app data management before.

edit.wdog.class.title: Response to the system about the criticality:
edit.wdog.class.f0.info: Informs the system that a watchdog has been triggered with a minor error.
edit.wdog.class.f6.info: Informs the system that a wachtdog has been triggered with a critical error.
edit.wdog.config.title: Task behavior:
edit.wdog.config.disable.info: The task is not triggered anymore after triggering the watchdog.
edit.wdog.config.continue.info: The task is triggered even after the watchdog is triggered until the maximum nunber of consecutive errors is reached.
edit.wdog.maxerror.info: The task is disabled when the max. number of consecutive errors is reached.

add.title: Add task
add.name.error1: The name has more then 15 characters

delete.title: Delete task '{{name}}'
delete.desc: Are you sure you want to delete task '{{name}}'?

empty.title: No tasks configured
empty.info: 'Add task' allows to add a task to the Scheduler.

add.title: Add callable to '{{name}}'
add.button.syncpoints.title: SyncPoints (recommended)
add.button.runindex.title: Run-Index
add.button.runindex.info: Run this callable via call sequence
add.runindex.title: Set 'Run-Index' for callable '{{callablename}}'
add.panel.title: Currently active call sequence
add.syncpoint.before.title: Before which SyncPoints is the callable '{{callablename}}' called:
add.syncpoint.after.title: After which SyncPoints is the callable '{{callablename}}' called:

delete.title: Delete callable '{{name}} - {{cid}}'
delete.desc: Are you sure you want to delete '{{name}} - {{cid}}'?

settings.title: Scheduler settings
settings.state.title: State - Specifies to which target state the Scheduler should switch after switching on
settings.state.operating.info: Tasks are called and callables are ready to operate
settings.state.setup.info: Tasks are called and callables can be configured
settings.state.service.info: Tasks are not called, callables are inactive and apps can be installed
settings.timeout.title: Timeout - Specifies the time how long the Scheduler waits for additional components during startup
settings.reaction.title: Error reaction - Specifies how the Scheduler reacts to a timeout during startup
settings.reaction.continue.info: The Scheduler continues the startup without the missing components
settings.debug.info: The hardware watchdog is deactivated when the Debug mode is active
